reviews.text: My wife,our 6 year old son and myself have just returned today from a 3 night stay in the Cologne Marriott hotel,and I would like to say that while the hotel was very nice in every way,it is not a 5 star hotel. We got a very good deal on 1800hotels.ie for 380 euro for 3 nights including breakfast. Our room on the 3rd floor was very clean and roomy and the reception and dining room staff were very helpful and friendly.The location of the hotel is excellent,and is only 200metres from the main train station. The breakfast was superb with a huge choice of food and of very high quality. This hotel is of a high standard but it should be advertised as 4 star. Paul Mooney. Ireland.
reviews.title: Very good but not 5 star quality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Got a good deal -£219 for 3 nights. When we arrived we upgraded to the 6th floor which included breakfast and access to the Executive Lounge, serving snacks and drinks after 5.30pm. A continental breakfast was also served here daily, but full English breakfast which was good, was in the regular dining room. The room was exactly the same as in the picture on the website and was very clean and comfortable. The Marriott is in a good position - fairly near to the railway station, through which was a shortcut to the Dom and the main restaurant/shops area. Would definitely stay (and upgrade) again.
reviews.title: Clean, smart hotel and good value

reviews.text: On a one night business trip. Hotel was just ok. Met all the regular amenities although we had to press for the luggage to be brought to our room. The porter was not there so front staff got it!
reviews.title: Ok

reviews.text: Lobby/lounge is a bit saddish but we dined at a nearby restaurant/bar (forgot name, pretty swanky) from the hotel(street is full of bars and restaurants) and had fun since it was football time and the germans are very serious about their game!
reviews.title: Construction noise will be ongoing thru June - be advised
Perfect Birthday in Cologne
reviews.text: Nothing much to report on the hotel, but loved the city just to walk around , by the river, see the church, many pretty sights.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We Stayed at his hotel for a long weekend to visit the christmas markets. This is one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel!!!

reviews.text: The Room was very spacious and clean with the best beds we have ever slept in. The Bathroom was also spacious and was cleaned to the highest standard every day..plenty of towels and toiletries etc.
reviews.title: Great for the Christmas Markets
Great breakfast!
reviews.text: The Staff are very friendly and checking in and out was very quick and effiicent.
Breakfast in the Hotel was brilliant and we couldn't have asked for more..a wide choice...you could never go hungry and it will set you up for the day!!
reviews.title: Outstanding Hotel

likes.liked: — Executive Lounge, Housekeeping, Decor, In-room safe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel is in a good location and perfect for sightseeing and the Christmas markets. The Markets were extreamly busy but thats not surprising when people travel from all over the world to see them...a good atmosphere tho!!
reviews.title: Luxurious American style hotel

likes.liked: — Room high quality, very close to train station

reviews.text: Modern hotel in perfect location just a short walk from the main train station and the centre. Rooms, service and food are as you can expect it from a good Marriott hotel. I appreciated the personal touch the front desk staff gave to the registration including a very friendly welcome and a handshake. Very decent prices on weekends.
reviews.title: Very good hotel
Christmas Preview
reviews.text: The only negative point is that the hotel is not smoke-free. When I wanted to enjoy a glass of wine in the bar (which is offered by the hotel for elite members) in the bar the place was full of cigar smoking guests, so there was a very unpleasant smell in the place.

We stayed at this lovely Hotel for 3 Nights and was very pleased with the Hotel. Our room overlooked the river and was beautifully furnished with coffee and Tea makers. A lovely bathroom with a very good shower.and plenty of toiletries. We asked for more tea and milk and it was sent up straight away. We had breakfast and Dinner in tbe Resturant and it was excellant. My husband and I travel abroad alot amd can honestly say. This Hotel was first class. . John and Shelagh Mcintyre Newcastle England
reviews.title: Germany vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unbelievable.....Since this trip was part of a German holiday tour, decided to do it right at this hotel. Hotel was / or is recently renovated. Is very upscale, and the interior of the hotel is fabulous. We stayed in a suite, which was great and very spacious. Bathroom was even spectacular. If you can afford a suite, it gets you excutive lounge privileges which gets you all the free beer, food, liquor you could want. They even put out a nice spread to snack on. Staff was very friendly and attentive, and strive to meet all your needs. Hotel is a short walking distance from the train station, and in close proximity to the Dom Cathedral, and several bars and restuarants. Rhine river is less than a block away from this hotel. Probably the best Marriot I have stayed in. If you happen to visit Cologne, this is the place to stay.
reviews.title: Perfect Location & Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here in early December to see the Christmas markets & meet some friends in the city. The location of the hotel is outstanding for the markets & anything within the city centre. The restaurant for breakfast is fantastic & although they seemed busy at dinner time the food was good. We arrived early but fortunatly the room was ready & we found the room great.
reviews.title: Nice, but some staff needs improvement

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the largest room we had in the whole two weeks we were traveling in Europe. It was nicely furnished and the amenities were excellent.
reviews.title: Cologne Marriott

reviews.text: The hotel was very convenient to the train station - within a few minutes walking distance - and, since the cathedral is right next to the train station - on the opposite side from the hotel, it was convenient to the only tourist sight we had time to visit.
reviews.title: Great, all-around hotel

likes.liked: — Location, Executive Lounge, the Bar, My Room

reviews.text: We only stayed one night, but had no complaints at all about the hotel. The only disappointment was that breakfast was not included - the only hotel we stayed at where it wasn't. We knew that from the Marriott website so it wasn't a surprise. We had used Marriott points for the room and, when checking in, requested courtesy access to the executive lounge, where we knew they served a continental breakfast; however, since we only had silver elite status - and not gold elite - they wouldn't give us that. In the US, we have always been upgraded or at least given executive lounge access, especially on reward stays; I don't know if it was just this hotel, or Marriott in Germany, or Marriott in Europe, but they wouldn't budge off the gold elite policy.
reviews.title: Boutique Type Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Anyway, the stay came at the middle of our trip and it was a nice break from the smaller accomodations we had both before and after.
reviews.title: Good location, lovely staff, v comfortable rooms!

reviews.text: I have stayed in several places around Cologne and this by far is my favourite. Great location by the Train Station, very modern hotel with a great, snappy bar, and spacious rooms.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: i stayed with my firend 10/07.When we enter the hotel we directly go to front dest and we mahe our check-in.When i bookd my reservation i made my resevation one double room with twin bed.But when we make our check-in receptionist force us to get a double bed room or double bed room with extra bed.Receptionist give me the reason that they get a group reservation and they guaranteed their room with twin bed.But they don't guaanteed our twin room request ,because we made our reservation from Marriot web page.Our twin room is just request.After that i don't accept their offer and want to make resevation from Savoy Hotel.She call there and told me that there is no available room.Then we said to her we need a internet connection to make our reservation from somewhere else.She offer us bussines center and it is costed 25 eu.Than i really become upsad and call my company and make a reservation for me.When we are waiting reply she turn back and said to me ' You are lucky .There is a cancelation just a few minutes before and we can stay there'.i am really sorry but i donnot belive.We stay there.Because we have a limited time for our holday.
reviews.title: What a terrible check-in....!
Wi-fi rip-off
reviews.text: i stayed there next year too.And i liked their service very much.But this time They really make me upsad when i make my check-in.i espaccially choose 5 stars hotel ,because my holiday should be perfect.But this service not 5 star service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also i fill the reveiw for from hotel ,but they still not turn me back for maybe small excuse.
reviews.title: Friendly & good location

reviews.text: Maybe if i get some reply than i can feel better.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: In so many ways this is a very nice hotel in a very convenient location, but if wi-fi internet is important to you then stay away. Wi-fi connection costs €3.96 for first 15 minutes and €0.26 for every minute thereafter. Do the maths and that adds up to a charge of more than €15 per hour for EVERY hour you spend online. Plus you have to log-in anew with full credit card details EVERY time you wish to go online. I regularly stay in hotels all over Europe and have never come across such exorbitant prices for wi-fi. Other hotels in Cologne offer free wi-fi (as any decent business hotel should), or else offer a 24/48 hour pass for a fixed fee, or else they are in zones where you can pick up public access services. To charge more than €15 per hour for EVERY hour is just scandalous. Staying in touch through internet is important to me when I am away and for that reason I will not come back to this wi-fi rip-off hotel unless they start advertising free wi-fi access.
reviews.title: Excellent Service & Location!!
